Well here we go again. I beat the original first and second on the phone rendering me a master at megaman. So in excitement i bought the third in the series. I was upset. The slow down totally threw me off my groove and required me to adjust to the new gameplay. I like the new bosses my favorite being gemini man and the updated graphics were superb. I did feel like the endgame boss was very easy but i ignored and beat the game. For the love of god fix the slowdown. Any slower is bad for my heart

This app is horrible. It runs at 5 frames per second, the button controls are laggy, and the screen doesn't support higher resolution phones. Also, the menus are horribly done, and they look sloppy. These 2 stars are for the actual game. Buy the Legacy Collection. Not this.

Mega Man 3 is a real solid title, fair controls, nice new features, and gave us Proto Man! Honestly it's the last good Classic Mega Man game

Controls are just impossible to handle. When trying to move left, the Options panel pops up. That resets the stage music too. Bugger! Moving left can only be done by jumping first . When losing a life it's immediate "game over" and you need to start the stage from the beginning, which seriously takes the fun out of playing. I had high hopes for this game, it sucks that this cost me time and money but for my investment I only got frustration in return.
a pad soultion like using octopus app in the store which works great on megaman
I really really love this game but the input lag and clunky touch screen controller make it impossible to play, i guess if you have phone controller it's ok but without it ? Absolutely no

MM3 Is where we are introduced to more characters such as Rush the Dog, and Protoman. The gameplay is both a step up and a step down from 1 and 2. for 1 the first hafth of the game is easily the best with the detail in the backgronds, the music is overhalled with varaity. and the Robot Masters are more harder but not unbetable. unfortinatly the second hafth is where things start to fall apart. such as the incredibly difficult Doc Robots. And the incredibly easy Dr. Wily stages.

I bought Megaman 2 and 3, but unfortuntately they do not have support for bluetooth controllers, I will wait for Capcom to add BT support in order to buy the rest, as it is nearly impossible  to play the hard mode without a real controller.

Got this thing thinking it was a paid emulator and that all the negative ratings about the framerate was just classic NES lag. Nope.

It's alright. It's not what I was expecting. The gameplay is slow and unresponsive. The controls are weak and you can't change powers on the fly (like in the NES version). It's a good trip down memory lane, as long as you keep your expectations in check. This is NOT Mega Man of old. This is a shadow of Mega Man, but it is alright if you don't expect much. Had I to do it again, I would not spend 2 bucks for it.
Its a good port but touchscreen controls are just not made for precision platforming.
Brings back NES memories. Ready for the mobile version of the SNES Megaman X!
My dad plays this game and I always thought that one day I would play it to and here I am playing a game my dad STILL plays WOW :)!

While the game is there and shows promise, the execution here is poor. Frame skips no matter what mode you're on are the worst problem. Controls, while playable, are not the best. Slides are difficult. Also emailed support about playing experience before reviewing and received no response.
<3 <3 <3     <3 <3 <3     <3 <3 <3
I thought there was no more megaman ) : but when I heard about the news of megaman coming to android, I was so happy!! :D thanks CapCom!!

The controls are rough to begin with after playing through MM1 and MM2 but now that you have to slide its even worse. I can't wait to see the mega buster of MM4. Besides that, easy mode is perfect for mobile gaming.

The more I play, the more problems I find. Note: this is a port from a Japanese phone version at least 8 years old! What's wrong: diagonal inputs don't work at all (shadow blade loses a lot from this, and ladders are impossible to grab sometimes). Speed is off, no matter what setting you use. The AI is off (enemies don't work as they should). The whole game is a hot mess. See the Sonic CD port to see a classic game redone correctly. I love MM3, but this is horrible. Wish I could refund now.

While it's great that Capcom has made these for mobile, the gameplay is not conducive to touchscreens at all. Not only is sliding impossible, but there is also a distinct lack of reasonable frame rate as well. I would recommend the legacy collection got ds over these mobile ports.
As a Mega Man fan for 20 years, I had thoughts going in after that questionable trailer. Was not disappointed. More quality work by Capcom
replyContent: We're sorry you're not enjoying the game. Consider playing in fast mode.  It may improve your experience.

content: If you are suffering low fps in game press the cogs top left and set speed to fast. Not a bad port but not really a remaster?! Gamepad recommended.
